resources.string: ChineseZodiac
bg_image
Get Chinese Zodiac
My Chinese Zodiac
Did you know?
The Chinese Zodiac is based on a 12-year cycle that corresponds to the 12-year orbit of Jupiter, the largest planet in our solar system.
The Chinese Zodiac is also known as Sheng Xiao or the "birth year animal" in Chinese.
The 12 animals of the Chinese Zodiac are: Rat, Ox, Tiger, Rabbit, Dragon, Snake, Horse, Goat, Monkey, Rooster, Dog, and Pig.
The Chinese Zodiac is deeply rooted in Chinese astrology and has been used for thousands of years to guide people in matters of love, career, and health.
The Chinese Zodiac is celebrated during the Lunar New Year, which typically falls between late January and mid-February each year.
Each animal sign is associated with a different set of lucky numbers, colors, and directions, which are believed to bring good fortune and ward off bad luck.
The Chinese Zodiac is based on a 12-year cycle that corresponds to the 12-year orbit of Jupiter, the largest planet in our solar system.
